meta.title: VS Code Vert.x Starter Extension
meta.summary: Today, we are really excited to announce the Visual Studio Code Vert.x Starter extension. It allows you to create a Vert.x project, customize the creation, and search for dependencies.

content.renderedOutput:
Hi Vert.x com­mu­nity! Today, we are re­ally ex­cited to an­nounce the Vi­sual Stu­dio Code Vert.x Starter ex­ten­sion.

The ex­ten­sion is a com­mu­nity con­tri­bu­tion made by Daniel Petisme (@danielpetisme).

Usage

Vi­sual Stu­dio Code is a pop­u­lar code ed­i­tor with a lot of ad­di­tional ex­ten­sions.

Vi­sual Stu­dio Code Vert.x Starter ex­ten­sion al­lows you to:

  • Cre­ate a Vert.x project
  • Cus­tomize the cre­ation (Vert.x ver­sion, lan­guage, build tool, groupId, artifactId, pack­age name, JDK ver­sion)
  • Search for de­pen­den­cies

The ex­ten­sion can be con­fig­ured to match your con­text (e.g. defin­ing your de­fault com­pany groupId).

How it works

Be­hind the scene, the ex­ten­sion re­lies on the Vert.x ap­pli­ca­tion gen­er­a­tor API and demon­strate how easy it is to de­velop your own IDE plug­in or cus­tom tool­ing to gen­er­ate Vert.x projects. For fur­ther de­tails about the start.vertx.io API, please refer to the Vert.x Starter project on GitHub.

Questions?

Feel free to ask ques­tions or pro­pose new fea­tures on the VS­Code Vert.x Starter GitHub repos­i­tory.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.8.0 released!
meta.summary: We are extremely pleased to announce that Eclipse Vert.x 3.8.0 has been released. This is an important release introduceing a few changes ramping up to Vert.x 4.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.7.1
meta.summary: We have just released Vert.x 3.7.1, a bug fix release of Vert.x 3.7.x and a few small features.

meta.title: Contract Driven REST Services with Vert.x3
meta.summary: We see a new trend in development where we are shifting from developing applications to APIs. More and more we see services being offered as REST APIs that we are allowed to consume.

meta.title: Presentation of the Vert.x-Swagger project
meta.summary: This post is an introduction to the Vert.x-Swagger project, and describe how to use the Swagger-Codegen plugin and the SwaggerRouter class.

meta.title: TCP Client using Eclipse Vert.x, Kotlin and Gradle build
meta.summary: In this blog post, I demonstrate how to write a very simple TCP client that keeps a connection open to a custom-written server in cloud.
